author: potuz
content: Why is the flow broken? Is it that we now need to get the full thing and not just the transactions? I think the same semantics should be preserved, the CL will keep a blinded execution payload envelope, and will the request the entire execution Payload from the EL to assemble the envelope

author: ethdreamer
content: It's broken because you need the full execution payload and not just the transactions. Payload bodies doesn't provide the full payload

author: ethdreamer
content: At least not unless we create a new version

author: potuz
content: Ah yeah with that I agree, we need to recover the full Payload. But I often wandered about the usefulness of that method itself... I'll ask that question in the call I guess

author: terencechain
content: My initial thoughts are we shouldn't even need to do this in the CL. The CL only serves consensus data to users, which always includes the header instead of the full payload. If users want full EL data, they could obtain it directly from the EL. The separation of concern is nice. That said, I think I missed an important point, which is that the CL needs to serve payloads by ranges over P2P
